data.headline: Australia Post, Woolworths, Westpac pay to access startups via CoVentured portal
data.summary: Big companies including Optus and Westpac have paid $25,000 each to post problems that start-ups will compete to solve through a new portal.

data.headline: Convenience the new weapon in grocery war
data.summary: Ready-made food, new store formats and online shopping will become the weapons of choice as major supermarket chains defend their turf and meet the needs of millennials.

data.headline: Amazon gears up to take on Coles, Woolworths
data.summary: Amazon is in talks with almost 20 per cent of food and grocery suppliers as the e-tailer prepares to take on Coles and Woolworths in the $3 billion online grocery market.

data.headline: Murray River Organics teeters after third downgrade
data.summary: It just gets worse at Murray River Organics.

data.headline: Aldi keeps pressure on Coles, Woolworths by cutting prices
data.summary: German discount grocery chain Aldi is hoping a new brand campaign, store refurbishments and an expanded fresh food offer will drive more customers through its doors as it scraps for its share of the $90 billion sector.

data.headline: Meriton to go up in Dee Why: approval given for two 17-storey apartment towers
data.summary: Approval brings 17-level towers to traditional low-rise area on Sydney's northern beaches.

data.headline: Woolies' boss Banducci and former QBE boss O'Halloran shake the box for Salvos
data.summary: Nothing opens corporate wallets faster than a case of the guilts. Just ask Salvos' spruikers Brad Banducci and Frank O'Halloran.

data.headline: Caltex Australia gains ACCC clearance for Milemaker Petroleum deal
data.summary: Caltex Australia is pressing ahead with its $95 million acquisition of Milemaker Petroleum's retail fuel business after overcoming competition concerns.

data.headline: Price war odds rise as Woolworths outpaces Coles
data.summary: The battle for market share between Woolworths and Coles has reached a dangerous juncture.

data.headline: Goodman Fielder factory closure delayed by competition concerns
data.summary: Goodman Fielder has been forced to postpone plans to shut its only WA bakery because of competition concerns over a supply agreement with a major rival.

data.headline: Woolworths' BIG W to lose $160 million before implementing turnaround plan
data.summary: Woolworths has come up with a new turnaround plan to save BIG W but it won't stop losses blowing out to more than $160 million this year.

data.headline: Maggie Beer Products shifts online to Melbourne, millennial focus
data.summary: Maggie Beer Products is shifting its online distribution to Melbourne after a review found it needs to focus more on the millennials.

data.headline: No price war, but Woolworths' soaring sales come at a cost
data.summary: If you want a reminder that nothing comes for free, then look past the stunning third-quarter sales growth figures at Woolworths.

data.headline: Woolworths posts strongest food sales growth since 2010
data.summary: Woolworths has posted its strongest supermarket sales growth since 2010, with same-store food sales rising 4.5 per cent in the March quarter.

data.headline: Amazon to wipe 16pc off retailer earnings: Fund managers
data.summary: Amazon will wipe 16 per cent off discretionary retailers' earnings within three years of entering Australia, according to surveys of fund managers and brokers by UBS.

data.headline: ASX poised to extend bullish run on earnings
data.summary: Despite setbacks and stumbles, global markets have retained a bullish bid since Donald Trump took the oath of office.

data.headline: Off-the-plan Woolworths sale to Chinese investors sets new benchmark
data.summary: A mainland Chinese investor has paid $13.5 million to buy a new Woolworth supermarket off-the-plan in Melbourne's inner suburbs.

data.headline: Chasing Woolworth down, down is costing Coles
data.summary: Coles is having to pay a price to hold its ground in the fight with Woolworths.

data.headline: Woolworths signs 15-year lease at Pellicano's South City Square
data.summary: Woolworths have agreed to a big new store in Brisbane's next big apartment project, expecting the boom in apartments will create strong trading at its new store.

data.headline: HelloFresh, Marley Spoon get the knives out in the fight for customers
data.summary: The knives have come out in the fast-growing meal kit delivery market, where Marley Spoon has accused arch rival HelloFresh of dirty tricks.

data.headline: Woolworths to proceed with Masters sale after Lowe's forced to sell back stake
data.summary: An arbitration process in the final stoush with Lowe's has cleared the way for Woolies' $1.5 billion exit plan.

data.headline: Retailers step up Amazon defences
data.summary: Loyalty programs, data analytics and in-store experiences will become the weapons of choice as Australian retailers fight to protect sales and earnings from online retail behemoth Amazon.

data.headline: Big River boss says detached housing to stay strong
data.summary: Big River eyeing acquisitions as the timber company prepares to list on the ASX later this year.

data.headline: Coles, Woolworths early settlement discounts under scrutiny
data.summary: Coles and Woolworths are charging small food and grocery suppliers discounts of almost 4 per cent for the privilege of receiving payment for goods in 30 days rather than 60 days.

data.headline: Craft beer has moved beyond bearded hipsters but it is getting very crowded
data.summary: It started with hipsters, but after doubling to 400 brewers in the past two years, the craft beer market has got very crowded.

data.headline: Meet the small supermarket suppliers beating the global consumer giants
data.summary: Small food suppliers are the envy of global conglomerates struggling to grow sales. Supermarket giants love them too.

data.headline: Woolworths shareholders to launch class action
data.summary: Shareholders are preparing to launch a $100m class action law suit against Woolworths over a profit warning that sent the shares down almost 14pc.

data.headline: Caltex chief Julian Segal joins queue of CEOs selling stock
data.summary: Julian Segal is just the latest CEO to sell stock in his own story. It's never a great sign.

data.headline: Lowe's still seeking more from Woolworths over Masters
data.summary: Lowe's has written down its stake in Masters to just $US103 million but is still seeking a much higher price for its share.

data.headline: Metcash to launch Price Match II to protect sales
data.summary: Metcash is working with IGA retailers and suppliers on a new price matching program to stem share loss, which has accelerated since Woolworths turned the corner.
